snippet: The Board of Health passed a regulation that will require written consent before an infant can have a form of Jewish ritual circumcision, prevalent in the ultra-Orthodox community.
abstract: New York City Board of Health passes a regulation that will require consent from parents before an infant can have a form of Jewish ritual circumcision, prevalent in the ultra-Orthodox community, in which the circumciser uses his mouth to remove blood from the incision; infectious disease experts widely agree that the oral contact creates a risk of transmission of herpes.
lead_paragraph: The Board of Health passed a regulation that will require written consent before an infant can have a form of Jewish ritual circumcision, prevalent in the ultra-Orthodox community.

headline.seo: Health Board Votes to Regulate Jewish Circumcision Ritual
headline.main: Board Votes to Regulate Circumcision, Citing Risks
headline.print_headline: Board Votes To Regulate Circumcision, Citing Risks
